newsitem.title: USA: Phila. schools deficit could hit $104 mln - paper.
newsitem.headline: Phila. schools deficit could hit $104 mln - paper.

text.p: Philadelphia School District could face a deficit as large as $104 million by fiscal 1998 without budget cuts or more aid, Philadelphia Inquirer reported Tuesday.
Citing figures from the district's managing director, Clarence Armbrister, the paper said the budget gap could grow to as much as $441 million by 2000.
The deficit for the current year's $1.4 billion budget was $10.7 million.

Armbrister said part of the problem is that school enrollment continues to climb even as revenues drop. He said he is working on a multi-year plan to address the shortfalls which would be released early next year.

Philadelphia School District's MBIA 5.35s of 2003 were being offered in the secondary market Tuesday at a 4.85 percent yield. JJ Kenney Evaluation Services priced the bonds Wednesday night at a 4.81 percent yield.
